title: Authors and Citation
text: Cucunubá ZM, Torres N, Lambert B, Nouvellet. P (2023). serofoi: Estimates Force--Infection given pathogen population based sero-prevalence studies.. R package version 0.1.0.
code: @Manual{,   title = {serofoi: Estimates the Force-of-Infection of a given pathogen from population based sero-prevalence studies.},   author = {Zulma M. Cucunubá and Nicolás Torres and Ben Lambert and Pierre Nouvellet.},   year = {2023},   note = {R package version 0.1.0}, }

title: Estimates the Force-of-Infection of a given pathogen from population based sero-prevalence studies.
text: serofoi version 0.1.1 R package estimate Force--Infection given pathogen population based sero-prevalence studies Bayesian framework.

title: Estimates the Force-of-Infection of a given pathogen from population based sero-prevalence studies.
text: can install development version serofoi GitHub :
code: # install.packages("remotes") remotes::install_github("TRACE-LAC/serofoi") library(serofoi)

title: Estimates the Force-of-Infection of a given pathogen from population based sero-prevalence studies.
text: examples illustrate current functionalities: function prepare_data() helps user prepare dataset use serofoi package Current version package runs three different models FoI. function run_model() allows choose betwwen three different models. Constant Force--Infection binomial distribution Time-varying Force--Infection prior normal-binomial distribution Time-varying Force--Infection prior normal-log distribution Function plot_seroprev() can used visualize sero-prevalence data corresponding binomial confidence interval fitting model:  model, three plotting functions:    three plots can obtained function plot_model()  Finally, package provides funcion get_comparison_table() allows compare three models based convergence, elpd p-values
code: data_test <- prepare_data(mydata) head(data_test) model_0 <- run_model(model_data = data_test,                      model_name = "constant_foi_bi") model_1 <- run_model(model_data = data_test,                      model_name = "continuous_foi_normal_bi") model_2 <- run_model(model_data = data_test,                      model_name = "continuous_foi_normal_log") plot_seroprev(data_test, size_text = 15) plot_seroprev_fitted(model_0) plot_foi(model_0) plot_rhats(model_0) plot_model(model_0) comp_table <- get_comparison_table(   model_objects_list = c(m0 = model_0,                          m1 = model_1,                          m2 = model_2))

title: Estimates the Force-of-Infection of a given pathogen from population based sero-prevalence studies.
text: package currently concept, defined RECON software lifecycle. means essential features mechanisms still developed, package ready use outside development team.

title: Estimates the Force-of-Infection of a given pathogen from population based sero-prevalence studies.

title: Extract Model Summary — extract_model_summary
text: model_object model_object. object containing relevant information implementation model. Refer fit_model details.

title: Extract Model Summary — extract_model_summary
text: model_summary. Object summary model_object containing following:

title: Extract Model Summary — extract_model_summary
code: model_data <- prepare_data(mydata) model_object <- run_model(model_data = model_data,                           model_name = "constant_foi_bi") #> Warning: Model constant_foi_bi is being compiled for the first time. This might take some minutes #> Warning: path[1]="inst/extdata/stanmodels/constant_foi_bi.stan": No such file or directory #> Warning: cannot open file 'inst/extdata/stanmodels/constant_foi_bi.stan': No such file or directory #> Error in file(fname, "rt") : cannot open the connection #> Error in get_model_strcode(file, model_code): cannot open model file "inst/extdata/stanmodels/constant_foi_bi.stan" extract_model_summary (model_object) #> Error in extract_model_summary(model_object): object 'model_object' not found

title: Fit Model — fit_model
text: Function fits selected model data

title: Fit Model — fit_model
code: fit_model(   model_data,   model_name,   n_iters = 1000,   n_thin = 2,   delta = 0.9,   m_treed = 10,   decades = 0 )

title: Fit Model — fit_model
text: model_data data frame containing data seroprevalence survey. details refer run_model. model_name Name selected model. Current version provides three options: constant_foi_bi Runs constant model continuous_foi_normal_bi Runs normal model continuous_foi_normal_log Runs normal logarithmic model n_iters Number interations eah chain including warmup. iter sampling. n_thin Positive integer specifying period saving samples. thin sampling. delta Real number 0 1 represents target average acceptance probability. Increasing value delta result smaller step size fewer divergences. details refer control parameter sampling . m_treed Maximum tree depth binary tree used NUTS stan sampler. details refer control parameter sampling. decades Number decades covered survey data.

title: Fit Model — fit_model
text: model_object. object containing relevant information implementation model. contains following:

title: Fit Model — fit_model
code: model_data <- prepare_data(mydata) fit_model (model_data,            model_name = "constant_foi_bi") #> Warning: Model constant_foi_bi is being compiled for the first time. This might take some minutes #> Warning: path[1]="inst/extdata/stanmodels/constant_foi_bi.stan": No such file or directory #> Warning: cannot open file 'inst/extdata/stanmodels/constant_foi_bi.stan': No such file or directory #> Error in file(fname, "rt") : cannot open the connection #> Error in get_model_strcode(file, model_code): cannot open model file "inst/extdata/stanmodels/constant_foi_bi.stan"

title:
Run model
Runs the specified stan model for the force-of-infection — run_model
text: model_data data frame containing data seroprevalence survey. data frame must contain following columns: last six colums can added model_data means function prepare_data. model_name Name selected model. Current version provides three options: constant_foi_bi Runs constant model continuous_foi_normal_bi Runs normal model continuous_foi_normal_log Runs normal logarithmic model n_iters Number interations eah chain including warmup. iter sampling. n_thin Positive integer specifying period saving samples. thin sampling. delta Real number 0 1 represents target average acceptance probability. Increasing value delta result smaller step size fewer divergences. details refer control parameter sampling . m_treed Maximum tree depth binary tree used NUTS stan sampler. details refer control parameter sampling. decades Number decades covered survey data.

title:
Run model
Runs the specified stan model for the force-of-infection — run_model
text: model_object (complementar cuando escriba la documentación de fit_model y fit_model_log)

what:
Save or load model
This function determines whether the corresponding .RDS file of the selected model exists or not.
In case the .RDS file exists, it is read and returned; otherwise, the object model is created through the stan_model function, saved as an .RDS file and returned as the output of the function. — save_or_load_model
title:
Save or load model

In case the .RDS file exists, it is read and returned; otherwise, the object model is created through the stan_model function, saved as an .RDS file and returned as the output of the function. — save_or_load_model
text: Save load model function determines whether corresponding .RDS file selected model exists . case .RDS file exists, read returned; otherwise, object model created stan_model function, saved .RDS file returned output function.
